notes: Antipassive suffix for low vowel roots; linker suffix for low vowel roots. Harmonizes with root vowel height.
Signals that the main clause's agent is the subject of the linked clause. For low vowel roots.
null: -ja (antipassive) + -ja (linker)

notes: Antipassive suffix for high vowel roots; linker suffix for high vowel roots. Harmonizes with root vowel height.
Signals that the main clause's agent is the subject of the linked clause. For high vowel roots.
null: -ji (antipassive) + -ji (linker)

notes: Marks ongoing/habitual action. Placed after initial (C)C of verb root.
Marks movement 'to
null: towards'. Attaches to NP-final word. Does not participate in vowel height harmony.
e.g.
ipisi-ki (to the child)

notes: Marks static location 'in
null: at'. Attaches to NP-final word. Does not participate in vowel height harmony.
e.g.
akʼat-kʼa (at the man)

notes: Marks instrument 'with'. Attaches to NP-final word. Does not participate in vowel height harmony.
Marks future/intended action. Placed after initial (C)C of verb root.
Marks completed action. Placed after initial (C)C of verb root.
Marks source 'from'. Attaches to NP-final word. Does not participate in vowel height harmony.
Valence-increasing suffix. Adds a causer argument.

sand-water. Compound noun. Nasal harmony. Pitch accent on first syllable.
null: kà (water) + pʼã̀s (sand)
`kà` is a hypothetical bound morpheme for 'water'
related to `pã́`. The compound is classified as a low vowel root for affix harmony purposes.

fire-eat. Mixed vowel root compound. Pitch accent on second syllable.

notes: 1PL ABS prefix. Low vowel form. Used with low vowel verb roots. Low tone.
1S/1PL ABS prefix. `tì-` is the prefix for 1S ABS with all verbs. It is also the prefix for 1PL ABS with high vowel verbs. The 1PL ABS prefix for low vowel verbs is `tã̀-`. Low tone.
small-tree. High vowel root compound. Nasal harmony. Pitch accent on third syllable.
null: tìp (small) + nĩ̀sĩ́ktĩ̀ (tree)
Focus is on `nĩ̀sĩ́ktĩ̀`
so `tìp` loses its tone.
